knowledge.markdown:
# Erdős #21 - Covering Intersecting Families

## Problem Statement

Let f(n) be the minimum size of an intersecting family F of n-sets such that every set of size ≤ n-1 is disjoint from at least one member of F.

**Is f(n) = O(n)?**

## Status

**Erdős Database Status**: SOLVED ($500 prize)

**Solution**: Kahn (1994) proved f(n) = O(n)

## History

- 1975: Erdős-Lovász conjectured f(n) ≪ n, proved (8/3)n ≤ f(n) ≪ n^(3/2) log n
- 1992: Kahn improved to f(n) ≪ n log n
- 1994: Kahn proved f(n) = O(n), resolving the conjecture

## Known Exact Values

| n | f(n) | Source |
|---|------|--------|
| 1 | 1 | Trivial |
| 2 | 3 | Trivial |
| 3 | 6 | Tripathi 2014 |
| 4 | 9 | Tripathi 2014 |
| 5 | 13 | Barát-Wanless 2021 |
| 6 | 13-18 | Barát-Wanless 2021 |

## Conjectured Exact Bound

f(n) = 3n + O(1)

---

*Formalized 2026-01-23*
